author: raghushantha
body:
I built using the Win7 CoreCLR runtime.

`Start-PSBuild -Runtime win7-x64`

![pasted image at 2016_08_09 06_44 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11727200/17539570/076bce64-5e64-11e6-8a8b-53cfbb1461da.png)

comments.author: raghushantha
comments.body:
Installing the VC++ update does not help.

https://download.microsoft.com/download/1/1/5/11565A9A-EA09-4F0A-A57E-520D5D138140/Windows6.1-KB2999226-x64.msu

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Well I'm glad I ran across this.  I've been running into various issues trying to build on Win7 x64 using the VC++build tools (instead of VS).  Looks like I can save myself some time and pitch that experiment and try again on a Windows 10 VM.

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body: The PInvokes are targeting incorrect versions of the API sets. I'm adjusting them to see if that resolves the issue.

title: Win7SP1 x64 PowerShell.exe crash
